items.hed: Joss Whedon Says His Battle with Marvel Got “Really Unpleasant”
The Story Behind Rihanna’s Red Carpet-Winning Met Gala Dress
How Avengers: Age of Ultron Secretly Prepped Us for Future Marvel Movies
items.dek: Here’s how to understand all the references that might not have made any sense at the time.

As Hollywood stars converge in downtown Manhattan for the annual Tribeca Film Festival, photographer Fabrice Dall’Anese pulls them out of the festival fervor for these intimate portraits, shot in the Smyth Hotel and all over New York City.

items.hed: Joss Whedon Says His Battle with Marvel Got “Really Unpleasant”
items.body:
Joss Whedon has been slowly letting his dissatisfaction with the Marvel Studios creep out in interviews for a while now, whether it’s [defending __Edgar Wright’s__ vision for *Ant-Man*]( http://variety.com/2015/film/news/ant-man-edgar-wright-joss-whedon-1201477447/) or [calling out sexism]( http://www.buzzfeed.com/adambvary/joss-whedon-clarifies-comments-misogyny-superhero-movies#.fpEeN50Vz) in the comic book film industry. But it seems *that* was Whedon holding back, because now that he’s no longer technically employed by Marvel, Joss is getting very specific about his frustrations. It’s not pretty. 

In an interview on the Empire Film Podcast (where, caution, Whedon drops plenty of spoilers about the film), the director said he had to struggle to keep some of the slower, character-driven moments that gave the film its patented Whedon flair. Hawkeye visiting his family at their farmhouse and those Scarlet Witch nightmares were not a hit with the studio, but the extended sequence where Thor visits a cave and has a vision of the Infinity Stones was, essentially, a mandate. Whedon said: 

> The dreams were not an executive favorite either — the dreams, the
> farmhouse, these were things I fought to keep … With the cave, it
> really turned into: they pointed a gun at the farm’s head and said,
> “Give us the cave, or we’ll take out the farm,” — in a civilized way.
> I respect these guys, they’re artists, but that’s when it got really,
> really unpleasant.

But the original version of Thor’s cave plot was, based on what Whedon suggests, more lucid than what ended up in the final cut. After Whedon’s concept—which featured __Chris Hemsworth__ shirtlessly channeling a prophecy—didn’t test well with audiences, it was cut down to a far less comprehensible version.  “Thor is always the hardest guy to integrate,” Whedon admitted, but thinks the studio “threw out the baby with the pond water” when it came to trimming a scene that was necessary to set up future films in the M.C.U. 

The theme that crops up over and over in the interview is how hard Whedon fought to keep both heart and character alive in the action-packed *Avengers* sequel. The studio had Whedon trim a sizable chunk of Natasha and Bruce’s story, about which Whedon says, “it was some of the most beautiful stuff and I hated to cut it.” In defense of the farm plot and the the introduction of Hawkeye’s family Whedon declares, “__Linda Cardellini__ is the fucking secret weapon of this movie. She is so wonderful.” Whedon’s refreshingly human take on blockbusters is part of what made *The Avengers* such a success, and every inch of that ground he lost in *Avengers: Age of Ultron* weakens the movie. But you can still see that signature Whedon touch even in the final over-loaded confrontation between the Avengers and Ultron’s robot army. Whedon talks about the important role Quicksilver’s death plays in the film saying in the end, “It’s a big explosion, who cares? But Wanda’s grief is extraordinary.”

Whedon’s love of character is so strong he even wanted to make room for two more players in the already-crowded cast. He said he would have included both Spider-Man and Captain Marvel in the final cut, but Sony and Marvel came to an agreement on Spidey late in the game and as far as we know, Captain Marvel *still* hasn’t been cast. Which is too bad; I can think of few people better to introduce the world to Carol Danvers than Joss Whedon. But for now, the M.C.U. will have to soldier on without him. 

__WATCH: Robert Downey Jr. on Marvel, Fitness, Food, and More__


[#video: //player.cnevids.com/embed/5408ddac69702d7395130000/51cc9f86bb8f554e4e000002](560x390)||||||

items.seoDescription: On the many ways the director struggled and often failed to keep the heart in Avengers: Age of Ultron.

items.hed: The Story Behind Rihanna’s Red Carpet-Winning Met Gala Dress
items.body:
The Met Gala red carpet was shaping up to be a respectful but restrained affair of tasteful red dresses and flame-like silhouettes on Monday night. Then __Rihanna__ appeared on the steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in an imperial yellow, fur-trimmed cape that was embroidered with scrolls and scrolls and scrolls of flora ([and a headdress!](http://www.vanityfair.com/style/2015/05/headdresses-go-to-accessory-2015-met-gala-red-carpet)).
 
“I’m so in love with this dress, but the train is insane!” Rihanna told VF.com on the red carpet. “I can’t really walk in it without any help—but it’s so worth it. I love this dress so much! It’s Chinese couture and it’s made by __Guo Pei.__ It’s handmade by one Chinese woman and it took her two years to make. I found it online.”
 
“I was researching Chinese couture on the Internet and I found it,” she said.


[#image: /photos/554821267df477df32ed0601]||||||





That makes fashion’s most-watched woman (pop diva, category) one of the few attendees at this year's Met Gala (theme: “China: Through the Looking Glass”) to wear a Chinese designer. It also caps off a big moment for Pei, who is fresh off a collaboration with MAC Cosmetics and has two garments in the Met’s exhibition. She is a go-to designer for Chinese stars like __Li Bingbing__ and __Zhang Ziyi__ and has been profiled by [*The Wall Street Journal*](http://blogs.wsj.com/scene/2013/04/25/creating-chinese-couture/) and *The New York Times Magazine*, but her name remains relatively unknown in Western fashion (a curious phenomenon of the kind the Met’s exhibit is well-poised to address). Profiling her in 2010, [__Cathy Horyn__ compared](http://tmagazine.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/12/01/year-of-the-couturiere/?_r=1) Pei to Charles James, the American couturier who was the subject of last year’s Costume Institute exhibit.
 
The laborious production process for Pei’s garments is something of a signature. Her “Magnificent Gold” dress that appears in the Met show took 50,000 hours to make, Pei told [the Cut](http://nymag.com/thecut/2015/04/chinese-couture-designer-releases-mac-collab.html), while her “Blue and Porcelain” dress, also on display, took 10,000 hours. 

In a comment that seems prescient of Rihanna’s show-stopping look on Monday, Pei told the blog of her designs, “The focus and the attention paid to this dress will make it remembered by the world—[what] I want is to make them remember. . . . It is my responsibility to let the world know China’s tradition and past, and to give the splendor of China a new expression. I hope that people do know China in this way.” 

—*with additional reporting by [Paul Chi](https://twitter.com/mrpaulchi)*

__WATCH: Rosie Huntington-Whiteley Tells Us About the Time She Air-Kissed Beyoncé__


[#video: //player.cnevids.com/embed/554a275661646d2345000000/51cc9f86bb8f554e4e000002](560x390)||||||

items.hed: How *Avengers: Age of Ultron* Secretly Prepped Us for Future Marvel Movies
items.dek: Here’s how to understand all the references that might not have made any sense at the time.
items.body:
*Avengers: Age of Ultron*, [for better or for worse]( http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/05/netflix-daredevil-avengers-age-of-ultron), had to serve many purposes: a sequel to *The Avengers*; a setup for films like *Captain America: Civil War, Black Panther,* and the two-part *Infinity War*; and a spotlight for some of the more neglected members of Earth’s Mightiest Heroes. (Ahem, Black Widow and Hawkeye.) No wonder __Joss Whedon__ [was exhausted](http://www.vulture.com/2015/04/how-age-of-ultron-nearly-broke-joss-whedon.html). 

It’s unclear how involved his Marvel overlords were in determining what should and should not be in *Age of Ultron*, but there were a lot of balls in the air and one man to juggle them. It’s a shocker people enjoyed the film as much as they did. Now, whether they actually understood what was going on seems to be up for debate. 

Do you know what an Infinity Stone is? Our own __Richard Lawson__ [isn’t quite sure]( http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/04/avengers-age-of-ultron-review), and we told you [not to get too worked](http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/04/avengers-age-of-ultron-guide) up about them before seeing *Age of Ultron*. But if you’re ready for the big info-dump, and to have the next three years of blockbusters laid out before you, this guide is for you: a spoiler-filled breakdown of all the future films *Age of Ultron* set up.  


[#image: /photos/5548ea285d5d2a9b5bcce8a4]||||||





Captain America: Civil War (May 6, 2016)
----------------------------------------

The cat’s out of the bag: Captain America will be fighting Iron Man in the third solo outing for the star-spangled Avenger, due in theaters next May. *Age of Ultron* turned up the heat on the two, as seen in the wood-chopping confrontation between __Chris Evans’s__ Steve Rogers and __Robert Downey Jr.’s__ Tony Stark. Their words even briefly turned to blows when Stark was discovered completing the Vision ([that purple guy played by __Paul Bettany__](http://herocomplex.latimes.com/movies/avengers-age-of-ultron-paul-bettany-brings-the-vision-to-life-bids-jarvis-farewell/)), once again taking matters into his own hands instead of consulting the team. __Elizabeth Olsen, Jeremy Renner, Scarlett Johansson,__ and __Anthony Mackie__ will reprise their roles for *Captain America: Civil War*, and *Age of Ultron* is laying the groundwork for which side they will take. Scarlet Witch and Falcon are likely candidates for #TeamCaptainAmerica, given her mistrust of Stark and his loyalty to the Cap, as seen in last year’s *Captain America: The Winter Soldier*. War Machine (__Don Cheadle__), assuming he will return as well, is probably dedicated to his longtime buddy Tony, while folks like Hawkeye and Black Widow seem up for debate. The cards have been thrown. Now we wait to see where they fall.


[#image: /photos/5548ea2f121d7bad58dea2fc]||||||





Doctor Strange (November 4, 2016)
---------------------------------

*Age of Ultron* may not directly set up the events of [Doctor Strange]( http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2014/10/benedict-cumberbatch-doctor-strange-marvel), but it does introduce this universe to magic. Scarlet Witch is the first Earth-bound figure in the films to wield supernatural abilities. If you notice, she also uses the mano cornuto hand gesture, commonly a defense against the evil eye, in working her magic. This is Strange’s favorite symbol. Marvel said that __Benedict Cumberbatch’s__ Sorcerer Supreme will take us to [parallel dimensions]( http://marvel.com/news/movies/23542/marvels_doctor_strange_conjures_up_a_november_2016_release_date), and Wanda’s mind games—which send several Avengers into surreal, terrifying dream worlds—seem to be a taste. 


[#image: /photos/5548ea33121d7bad58dea328]||||||





Thor: Ragnarok (November 3, 2017)
---------------------------------

Even the mighty Thor isn’t immune to Scarlet Witch’s wiccan mojo. Wanda forces a vision on him that sees Asgardians partying like it’s the end of the world. But, actually, it is. A white-eyed Heimdall (__Idris Elba__) warns Thor that he’s taking them all to hell, and the third Thor movie takes its subtitle from [the apocalypse in Norse mythology](http://marvel.wikia.com/Ragnar%C3%B6k). The stars are said to fall from the sky, the Nine Realms will plunge into chaos, and giant wolves will devour the sun and the moon. If Marvel sticks to the comics, then Heimdall’s warning could be even more literal. In addition to the whole “hell on earth” omen, Ragnarok also sees souls rise from [Hel](http://marvel.com/universe/Asgard), the lowest of the Nine Realms and the afterlife for souls. [According to Marvel]( http://marvel.com/news/movies/23544/thor_brings_ragnarok_to_the_marvel_cinematic_universe_in_2017), *Thor: Ragnarok* picks up with Thor directly after the events of *Age of Ultron*. Much in the same way *Captain America: The Winter Soldier* sent ripples throughout the M.C.U., Marvel wants the same for this film.  


[#image: /photos/5548ea28121d7bad58dea2d0]||||||





Black Panther (July 6, 2018)
----------------------------

When the Avengers learn Ultron is after vibranium, they track down [Ulysses Klaw](http://marvel.com/universe/Klaw), a known purveyor of the precious metal. Played by Andy Serkis in the film, this character is a nefarious figure in the Black Panther comic books. Klaw killed the superhero’s father in his pursuit of vibranium, and in response Black Panther used the villain’s own technology to blast off his arm. Klaw seeks his revenge years later, having replaced his missing appendage with a sound transductor, his invention that transforms sound waves into physical matter. As __Mark Ruffalo’s__ Banner points out in the film, the tattoo on his neck is a Wakandan symbol, referencing Black Panther’s place of birth, the small African nation of [Wakanda](http://marvel.com/universe/Wakanda). Marvel shook things up a bit when they had Ultron be the one to cripple Klaw, but it saves them the trouble of weaving him an origin story when it’s time for [*Black Panther*](http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2014/10/chadwick-boseman-black-panther), which will introduce the character played by *42*’s __Chadwick Boseman.__


[#image: /photos/5548ea2f5d5d2a9b5bcce8d0]||||||





Avengers: Infinity War (May 4, 2018)
------------------------------------

Marvel has been laying the groundwork for their bigger plan [since the first Iron Man movie]( http://marvel.com/news/movies/23546/marvels_the_avengers_head_into_an_infinity_war), and that plan is *Infinity War*. After first popping up in [the mid-credits scene of *The Avengers*]( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YaXw4-NcFqs) and then again in *Guardians of the Galaxy* and the [mid-credits of *Age of Ultron*](http://www.cinemablend.com/new/What-Happens-Avengers-2-Mid-Credits-Sequence-What-It-Means-71199.html), Thanos will finally face off against Earth’s Mightiest Heroes with the Infinity Stones as his weapons. *Age of Ultron* revealed the stone in Loki’s scepter to be the Mind Gem (now living in Vision’s forehead), while we’ve already seen the Tesseract from *Captain America* and *The Avengers*, the Aether from *Thor: The Dark World* and the Orb from *Guardians of the Galaxy*; yes, they’re all Infinity Stones, too. As *__Benicio Del Toro’s__ Collector said*, there are six in total, so expect to see two more introduced down the road. Since Thor told Cap before blasting off to Asgard in *Age of Ultron* that he would search for the others, *Thor: Ragnarok* seems a likely spot for the next one. He better watch out for Thanos, because the “Mad Titan” is ready to do the dirty work himself. 

__WATCH: Robert Downey Jr. on Marvel, Fitness, Food, and More__

[#video: //player.cnevids.com/embed/5408ddac69702d7395130000/51cc9f86bb8f554e4e000002](560x390)||||||

items.hed: Headdresses Were the Go-To Accessory on the 2015 Met Gala Red Carpet
items.seoTitle: Headdresses Were the Go-To Accessory on the 2015 Met Gala Red Carpet
items.socialTitle: Headdresses Were the Go-To Accessory on the 2015 Met Gala Red Carpet
items.body:
When early arrival __Sarah Jessica Parker__ walked the Met Gala red carpet in a tasseled __Philip Treacy__ hat of bouquet-like flames, it seemed as though the high-fashion favorite had hit a singular note for the evening. But as the arrivals continued, the headdress proved *the* go-to statement accessory for the night—the one night each year on which red carpet-goers are chastised for not taking a bold risk. It was a useful way, it seemed, to pay a novel nod to the exhibit's theme, “China: Through the Looking Glass.”


[#image: /photos/554815865f9534293a8437f3]||||||



__Tabitha Simmons__ showed up in a gold Dolce & Gabbana get-up complete with a sculptural, baroque headdress that seemed plucked from a Francesco Borromini façade. 


[#image: /photos/554815885f9534293a84381f]||||||


Likewise, model __Karen Elson__ capped off her ensemble with a headpiece that resembled a spray of solid gold sparklers. 


[#image: /photos/554815867df477df32ed045c]||||||


Not content to stop there, the Italian design duo also provided over-the-top (literally) headgear for [a pair of Hollywood bright young things](https://twitter.com/TheJazzyBelle/status/595362348036005888): __Brie Larson__ and __Courtney Eaton__, accompanied by a bare-headed __Annabelle Wallis__.

And then [there was the matter of __Rihanna__](http://www.vanityfair.com/style/2015/05/story-behind-rihanna-red-carpet-winning-met-gala-dress)__.__ 


[#image: /photos/554821267df477df32ed0603]||||||

fields.title: t-met-gala-orient-head-pieces-trend.jpg
